title: New node joining an IBFT2 network with R1 and TLS fails to join the network after any blocks are created

labels.name: TeamGroot
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Groot Team

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Medium (ex: JSON-RPC request not working with a specific client library due to loose spec assumtion)

body:
### Description
As a node operator I would like to add new nodes to my network, eg as RPC nodes supporting API calls/blockscout etc

### Acceptance Criteria
Adding new nodes to an existing network with R1 and TLS would work as expected.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
See the attached zip file
1. Use the attached zip file and extract
2. In the docker-compose file comment out members2 and 3
3. Run it with `./run.sh`
4. Give it a couple of mins for blocks to be created
5.  In the docker-compose file uncomment members2 and 3 and bring them back
6. Start members2 and 3 with `docker-compose up -d member2` and the same for member3 respectiely
7. Check the logs with `docker logs quorum_dev_quickstart-member2_1` (check the name for your setup)


**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Nodes would just join the network and import blocks

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Nodes sit there hanging on peers=0 and no blocks are imported
```
(0xd10269b1f116dc1f8baa8960782ece8ed97abd5fe9797db029053985ce6fbaf8) for future import","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:33,600","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"EthScheduler-Timer-0","class":"FullSyncTargetManager","message":"No sync target, waiting for peers: 1","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:38,602","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"EthScheduler-Timer-0","class":"FullSyncTargetManager","message":"No sync target, waiting for peers: 1","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:40,459","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"nioEventLoopGroup-3-9","class":"TLSContextFactory","message":"Initializing SSL Context using JKS keystore.","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:41,370","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"nioEventLoopGroup-3-10","class":"TLSContextFactory","message":"Initializing SSL Context using JKS keystore.","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:42,166","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"nioEventLoopGroup-3-1","class":"TLSContextFactory","message":"Initializing SSL Context using JKS keystore.","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:43,603","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"EthScheduler-Timer-0","class":"FullSyncTargetManager","message":"No sync target, waiting for peers: 1","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:44,677","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"nioEventLoopGroup-3-2","class":"TLSContextFactory","message":"Initializing SSL Context using JKS keystore.","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-12-20T03:20:45,198","container":"c2c56abf2179","level":"INFO","thread":"nioEventLoopGroup-3-3","class":"TLSContextFactory","message":"Initializing SSL Context using JKS keystore.","throwable":""}
```

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
100%

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`besu --version`] 21.10.2
* Java version: [`java -version`] jsk11
* OS Name & Version: [`cat /etc/*release`] ubuntu 20.04 lts
* Kernel Version: [`uname -a`] 5.11
* Virtual Machine software & version: [`vmware -v`] n/a
* Docker Version: [`docker version`] 20.11.10
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Amazon Web Services I3-large] n/a

### Additional Information
[quorum-test-network-R1.tar.gz](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/files/7742509/quorum-test-network-R1.tar.gz)

Update for networks with K1 (in place of R1 and all else the same):

- on doing a restart where there is existing data is appears to work
- on adding a fresh node in we saw 2 errors on different machines:

Most likely same issue as https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/3207 so we will test this scenario once that is fixed.
We have confirmed that this is related to https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/3254. Please follow #3254 for tracking this bug.
